description: Staying at the awesome Mayflower Hotel just a block away from here, we were looking for a good coffee and Found It! Small cozy eclectic place with excellent cappuccino and such. Just right!
author: Valerie B.

description:
Nice owner. Messy inside though... half of the interior is blocked with boxes and stuff. Is he selling it, or what? References to the Netherlands ("De koffie staat klaar!") and Dutch breakfast, but in reality the menu doesn't resemble anything Dutch. Why bother? 
Anyway the breakfast wasn't bad. I think this is really a locals place. People getting coffees to go. Quaint and probably where I would get my coffee to go as well, but as a breakfast place a bit forgettable.
author: Jeroen D.

description: Best vanilla latte in the city. Excellent customer service and a comfortable atmosphere that feels like home.
author: Elliott P.

description: Great place to stop in for coffee. Have not tried the food items although they look good. Coffee is hot and cheap. Service comes with a smile and nice conversation. I like how close this place is to the place I stay very easy to grab a cup of coffee and head back to the place and finish what I need
author: Jessica S.

description: Funky little Café with delicious food and drinks. Warm little neighborhood vibe and the owner is very friendly. Nice cozy seating both inside and outside. Can't wait to come back and try more of the menu!
author: Sarah N.

description: In the heart of Downtown San Francisco. Next to the Canterbury Hotel is Cafe Bean.  Awesome place to get work done. High Speed internet and home of one of the best Hazelnut Coffees I have ever had.  Very down to earth and great location.
author: Andre C.

description: I stop almost everyday on my way to work for a cold brew and Chester and Nancy brighten my morning every time.  If you become a regular they will get to know your name and remember your favorite order.  They are truly kind people and their little spot is a gem in the neighborhood. The atmosphere is homey and eclectic with lots of plants.  It makes you feel comfortable right away.  This is my favorite coffee shop in the whole city.   Oh, AND they have three really good beers ON TAP... its crazy cool.
author: Christie C.

description: A small, quirky, cluttered corner cafe. I just had the coffee, which was good. Service was very friendly.
author: Brooke S.

description: A bought a nice fried egg sandwich for on the go walking. It's a running drippy egg. Fast service and friendly staff. Feels like a unique spot!
author: Susan T.

description:
Simple neighborhood cafe that serves coffee and draft beer, among other drinks, and also has a limited food menu at certain hours of the day. The decor and ambience is fairly homey, and the clientele seems to be mainly neighborhood residents on a first-name basis with the family owners. 

Cafe Bean probably won't be the best at any one thing, but it's the kind of true neighborhood establishment that seems increasingly rare these days in the West Bay.
author: Vincent L.

description: Grear Local joint!  Good coffee and killer breakfast sandwiches!  Small place but lots to choose from on the menu.  Dark roast coffee is great!
author: Jen H.

description: They kick you out even if you are a patron because you pulled out your laptop to start working and only bought a coffee from them - something you wouldn't expect other coffee shops to do. I don't ever think i'll be back.
author: Jun M.

description: Loved my Lattes each morning while staying at Wyndham Caterberry SF!! My husband walked over a block to get our morning coffees....perfect way to start our exciting 4 days in the city we love!!
author: Charles V.

description: Chester is my favorite part of this place. He's so friendly. This is more of a second wave coffee shop, which I actually like. I miss the funky 90's coffee shops. This place is reminiscent of that.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: There was a long line a crepe place so we came here instead. Unfortunately, there aren't crepes here anymore, but the food is great. The location makes you feel like a local and the owner, Chester, is welcoming and talks to you like you're a friend. The green tea latte is delicious!
author: Kelly T.

description: Not a lot of places serve chai tea, latte yes, straight tea, no. They had chai spice black tea, which was lovely to sip on while walking around a cold SF morning. Small place and they need to declutter though.
author: Hana A.

description:
Believe me...I REALLY wanted to enjoy this spot! I turned to Yelp to find a local, neighborhood cafe that wasn't your typical tourist joint- and with all of the great reviews, I thought this place would be a shoe-in. Sad to say, it wasn't so.

Perhaps you need to be a regular to truly appreciate this place. My experience was BLEH! It was messy beyond messy and didn't feel clean at all. I don't know if the place is undergoing some redesign/interior decorating changes- but it looks like hoarders have come in and settled in 1/2 of the dining area....oh and there was a ladder sitting in front portion of the sitting area. WEIRD!  Large food, drink and chip boxes sitting and balancing upon each other, old magazines and paper piled high, junk stacked upon junk. Serious clutter everywhere! They MUST be doing some serious spring cleaning....in the midst of winter, while all their guests pardon their literal dust.


As far as the food: I wondered if they even had a full kitchen in back. Our food tasted microwaved and "toaster oven'd".  In short- the food was nothing to brag about. I ordered:

Chai Tea Latte- Must have been from a flavor packet. When I took my first few sips- I would get random "crunches/crumbs" in my mouth- perhaps the owner/manager didn't stir the packet in to dissolve the powder?? I dunno....but gross!

My Nutella and Banana French toast was luke warm, toaster oven crunchy, and didn't taste like FRESH french toast. It LOOKED delicious when the gent delivered to the table though!

Daniel's Omelet- the egg look like a scrambled egg mix that came fresh out of the microwave! It was perfect in shape, rubber texture and color. The soggy veggies inside were par for the omelet course- and the dish came out steaming and overly piping hot. Not complaining about the temperature- but further made me think it just came out of the microwave. 

The owner/manager was nice enough. Not rude- but certainly not pleasant, perhaps because he didn't know us- and we weren't regulars. Customer service doesn't appear to be their forte. A kind smile and thank you can go a long way in the service industry. It appears that he didn't care- didn't care about our experience or about the way his place looked. A little bit of pride in their service can really help this place out.

All things considered, I may go back again in a couple months once the assumed spring cleaning and redecor takes place. It's very hodge-podgy and it appears the cafe is having an identity crisis....but perhaps that what gives it an artsy appeal. Vintage decor, some random "european" decor, random sports paraphernalia,  dated things/pictures randomly taped around the place.  Hey anything can be called "art"..... right? 

So many reviews talk about how wonderful the food and menu is here.... I'm hoping it was just an off day!
author: Sophie P.

description: The food and lattes are amazing! I had the hot green tea latte and the veggie burrito and both made my mouth so happy!
author: Cynthia T.

description: Great local coffee shop and friendly owner who seems to know all the locals and keep up on basketball. Whenever I stay in the city, I venture a few blocks away from the financial district for this little oasis.
author: Kannan R.

description: I came to sf from LA and had to rely solely on reviews when I came here and the fact that this cafe was 5 minutes away from where I was staying. The owner was so welcoming and the service was amazing. He took time out to sit with us and chat about the city and recommended us certain places and things to go see. He didn't have to do all that but he went above and beyond to help us and that alone was what made me give this place 5 stars. we ordered a jalapeño bagel egg bacon and cheese sandwich and it was so good that we ate two! One thing is this is not a place where food comes out fast we waited a while since the kitchen isn't too big. That however was minor and everything else made it worth the wait. next time I come to sf definitely will come a pay this place a visit.
author: Magali R.

description: I wasn't really feeling hungry but I polished off everything on the plate. The orange juice seemed freshly squeezed, not poured from a carton. And one of the owners gave me a complementary fortune cookie :)
author: Jenny K.

description:
The seating is really nice on one side (the side with the window-bench thingys) and really cramped on the other. If you're going to enjoy your food in the cafe, try to snag a window seat. 

I got a chai latte and a bagel with lox. The chai latte came out fast and was really nice, but it took a whole thirty minutes for my bagel to arrive, and it was kind of dry. Maybe it was a one time thing, but the wait really was a big deal for me, especially as I had to catch a movie right after. 

Still, the chai latte and awesome window seat won me over. Neat place.
author: Lin X.

description:
Perfect example of a great local SF find! The service is fantastic - down to earth, humble owners. Even though the space is small, the cafe has a comfy homey feel with the mixture of nook seating and communal seating areas. 

Top pick if you're in nob hill and looking some a "me time" spot to dig in a book over a tasty espresso. Love this place!! 

Oh and they have wifi!!
author: Kylie L.

description: Cafe Bean is wonderful.  The beverages and food are always great.  Chester and Nancy are always smiling.  If your looking for an easy fast morning coffee or a place to sit and enjoy your breakfast, Cafe Bean is the best.
author: Thibaud K.

description:
Down to earth. The owner is so nice. Friendly. You feel at home here. Don't come here looking for the Starbucks or Petes experience. Have patience. Stay a while. Chat a bit.

Everywhere I go when I order a bagel with cream cheese it always comes out with TOO much cream cheese. Like a barf inducing amount of cream cheese. Today, I ordered a bagel here and it came out with the worlds most PERFECT amount of cream cheese. Amazing.
author: Jessalyn D.

description:
FRAUD.

After finding out this place serves Dutch pancakes only on the weekend, I made sure that I stopped by here again on a Saturday morning while visiting from Long Beach. We waited 20 minutes for our food and when it finally arrived, I realized what I got was not actually a Dutch pancake. Its American pancake mix made into a very thin, crepe-like pancake. Flavorless by European standards. This Dutch girl and her Belgian companion were not impressed. 

The only saving grace was the thick, delicious bacon. Four dollars for 3 pieces though...
author: Karen F.

description: It all started on a hot morning, back in the summer of 2012. I stopped into Cafe Bean for an iced coffee. Fearing there may be hazelnut in the blend, I asked the owner if it was safe for a nut allergic patron. He replied by telling me everything about the blend, and put my fears at ease. Every time I returned, for the next year, he remembered my allergy and advised me on my drink selection. Probably the best service in San Francisco, if not the greater Bay Area. This is a five and a half star establishment.
author: Alex H.

description:
I'm not one of those people that write bad reviews constantly, actually, this is my first one:

I used to be a regular at Cafe Bean, every Saturday morning. It's around the corner from where I live.  I always noticed the mess, for example, for some reason one of their three main tables is always used to pile up old restaurant supplies.  I also knew it wasn't the cleanest place, as I've seen the staff go smoke around the corner and go straight back to handling your food.  But the decent coffee and their little corner covered with large cushions always made up for it and I continued to drop by for a coffee and a lox...  

... but being ripped off and yelled at in front of other customers is not OK.  I paid $22.50 for a lox (w/ extra lox), packaged orange juice and a coffee.  When I asked for additional lox to simply have enough to cover my bagel I was yelled at and told that moving forward they would not serve me extra lox ever again?!!

You will never see me here again!
author: Noam M.

description: This place was so sweet. A little bit of a mess overall -boxes stacked around, and a messy looking desk. Something about this place seemed really down to earth. The breakfast menu was legit. I had Chester's eggs one day and then a light breakfast -yogurt and granola the next day. The chai latte was REALLY good. I love chai latte's and they make it well. the other thing I liked about this place was that the staff was so sweet and friendly. They were really attentive and warm, that really stood out for me.
author: X O.

description:
Had a really good Brie/Spinach croissant sandwich here the other day.

The place is a decent size however it was pretty cluttered with product / boxes laying around (maybe temporary?)  It's seems like it's a neighborhood joint where regulars come for their cup o' joe. My coworker and I were the only two who really sat down to eat but there was quite a few people coming in and out for their afternoon fix while we were there. 

The man behind the counter with pink hair was very friendly. 

I'd come back :)
author: M E.

description: Randomly found this place when other Yelp reviewed cafes did not come through....just looking for a simple omelette and a latte, and was starting the get really hangry when I walked in here.  The service was perfect, the vibe was awesome and simple, the latte was excellent and the Codys Omlete was a little greasy but good enough.  So nice to eat somewhere so non-pretentious.
author: Nicole G.

description: This place sorta sucks.  Not really gonna sugar coat it or say how awesome the corner spot in downtown SF is.  Funky place with weird menu outside that doesn't match inside.  I mean really basic stuff for not basic price.  I got a simple egg, bacon, and cheese crossaint thing that was on the menu.  25 mins at least to get that to me.  One other person on the place eating and 2 with coffee. Not sure what the hell was going on back there but damn.  Water served in weird plastic elementary school type cups filled straight out of the tap right at the register.  No ice and warm.  Aldo there's this one big table in there maybe 6-7 seats and this one solo book reading woman taking up the whole table eating nothing with no awareness thst maybe a bigger group might need to sit there.  Find a different spot.
author: Ron C.

description: *based solely on customer service, not on food or drink...* Happened to be standing on the corner after meeting the bf from a haircut. Decided to pop in for a snack and to use the bathroom. Noticing that the bathroom had a out of service sign, my boyfriend asks about it as he hands over his couple of items to purchase. Without skipping a beat, the guy (I guess Chester) says "you need to purchase more than that to use it". My boyfriend then says, ok no problem I'll just get these and find somewhere else.Chesters response was then, "no I mean you need to buy more and I'll let you use it". Yes,..we get it, but after your rude response without waiting for us to even say if we were ordering food or drinks, just by glancing at the items in our hands we do not want to purchase anymore things from you, but we aren't going to be rude and walk away. We did then try to add a coffee but then Chester said "no no I'm only charging you for this, it's fine...." sooo confusing and bad customer service. I understand the need to make money and the need to not be used for a bathroom, but please.. This was an awkward horrible hospitality experience and I'm bummed cuz I love chai and wish I could have tried Chesters.
author: Bethany W.

description: Comfortable little place!! Best Iced Green Tea and Hot Vanilla Latte in the world. Stop here yesterday and had to stop again today.
author: Linda C.

description:
Cafe Bean is european in it's breakfast presentations.  there's a choice of omlettes, eggs, dutch pancakes, granola, yogurt, etc.

lunch offers crossaints, bagels, sandwiches, etc.
tables outside to sit in the sun.

just avoid the french roast (m, 1.75) coffee in the thermos by the register.
-pretty harsh, not so mellow tasting
-will surely keep one awake for hours..
author: Victor G.

description: I was walking around the area looking for a good inexpensive breakfast. I order a croissant ham, egg, & cheese with a small hot chocolate only for $10.28 Not bad for the city. Keep in mind you will be leaving with a happy tummy. =p
author: Princess D.

description: Awesome spot. Don't go if you're in a rush because there are only two employees, but if you have time to sit outside on a sunny day, then Chester will hook you up. My favorite breakfast is the "dog in heat" burrito and iced coffee. The brie and veggie sandwich is prefect for lunch.
author: Melissa C.

description: A quaint little cafe with great coffee however I tried to order pancakes at 9:30am and was told they were already out.
author: Laura B.

description:
It took us some days to find THE cafe in San Francisco. We had a week of holidays, walked our feet off and took breakfast in different places every day. Then we went back one evening on Sutter street and saw the Bean - we decided to take breakfast there the next day. After the first visit we always came back, until the holidays were over. 

Cafe Bean is such an uncomplicated, quiet and nice place. The coffee is wonderful (we live in Vienna and we both love coffee, so I dare to judge), the sandwiches are as well and they prepare them any style you ask them. The place is clean and there is a lot to see on the walls and in the corners. But the best is the owner - he is not just friendly, he is really a joyful character and we had a lot of fun with him. 

Thanks for some of the most pleasent moments in SF!
(The professor and his assistant :)
author: Georg M.

description: We had the lasagna and salmon pappardelle and they were delicious. The berry berry tart for dessert was amazing. The pizza looked very good. I so glad we walked in here
author: Heidi M.

description: Chester is the best! When business is booming he can add an employee to help with some of the things that can become overwhelming for a small business owner. It's hard to know how difficult it is to run a business until you decide to run your own!
author: Drew R.

description:
Won't be coming back here. 

Had a dutch pancake after all of the positive reviews and yeah "methinks not".  Not a fan of oily breadedness for breakfast. Pricey even for the touristy area. Many other delicious options in SF.
author: Ali B.

description: My favorite local coffee house. Consistently good locally owned shop. It's not the fanciest, but with outdoor seating in the meaning sun it's become one of the little joys in my life.
author: William R.

description:
I have been coming here for quite awhile, since it is my neighborhood coffee shop.
On my second visit ever, Chester new my name and drink. 
The coffee is good and the food is prepared to order which is always nice. If yiou are in a rush you can phone in an order and dash by to pick it up.

Definitely stop by if you like that local joint feel.
author: John A.

description: I feel like a grandma saying this, but the bread is so soft! I love how you don't have to bite down super hard to get to the delicious Turkey Club. I'd do it again, so do it.
author: Becca I.

description: Truly awesome little hole in the wall. Some might walk by a place because it isn't flashy but that would be a crime here! Great service, fantastic menu with quality tasting food served to your table by the owner himself. The coffee is some of the finest I've ever had, but the white chocolate mocha surpasses anyplace I've ever tried. Frequented this place while in San Fran for our honeymoon! Don't miss out!
author: C T.

description:
Quite an interesting Monday:

- Ate my tasty Chicken Katsu Curry (Extra Spicy @ my request) from Muracci's
- Shooing pigeons away from said take-out Chicken Katsu Curry @ Union Square
- WTF? Is that heartburn?
- Walgreens and a bottle of Maalox Cherry. [I drank it straight from the bottle]

I needed to alter the Universe.
So...I walked up a couple of blocks and saw Cafe Bean at the corner.
I waltzed inside and decided to go with an order completely un-D-Man-like.

I 
ordered
a 
single
green-tea
latte...

...there, I said it.

Quite a funny view.
Right there, on the table
My bottle of Maalox 
and the GT-latte

It was good. (the latte, not the Maalox)
The place was semi-full
and the menu looked enticing.
Clean place, and a terrific view of the surrounding neighborhood.
Ki Ni Shinai...3.5 stars!
author: Derek N.

description:
These guys are great, really. The owner/manager makes an effort to learn the names of his regulars (i am one of them!) and is always super friendly. It's a small cafe but there's a lot of seating and they have two great tables next to their big corner window so it's always sunny and warm! Plus, there are three or four sidewalk tables for when the weather is REALLY nice.

One warning: You will encounter art kids. Lots and lots of art kids. Their campus(es) for Academy of Art are all over this neighborhood and THIS is where they like to go. 
That being said, I'm usually only in and out for lunch so it's never really bothered me!

I've tried a few of their sandwiches and bagels, and they were all good but the one that stands out in my mind is the Club sandwich. Thick, incredibly soft bread (WHERE does this bread come from? It's amazing!!), fresh meat and a generous serving of avocado. Every bit worth the $8.95 they charge for it--they pretty much know me well enough now to know that I never order anything else!

Also he keeps two or three seasonal beers on tap which can be really nice to enjoy with your sandwich!

Solid, friendly small business overall. A great example of San Francisco's wealth of small, hole-in-the-wall eateries that constantly amaze and entice me :)
author: Kristen F.

description: Watch out for how much the bill is. The owner made a "mistake" on my order when he charged me. The place is also really dirty.
author: Jessica F.

description:
(First off, I really wish there was a better/more detailed rating system on yelp* as this was easily a 3.5-3.75 star rating, just not quite a 4 star.)

I went to café bean for breakfast this morning and had the Cinnamon Apple Dutch Pancake. It was very good and I can easily recommend it and would go back there to order it again any day. They have a very good variety of Dutch Pancakes from which to choose, too. And they also have several omelettes on the menu that might need to be checked out.

If you would like to read a more detailed review of my meal today, just click on my profile here and check out my stupid 'blog-thingy.
author: Brian M.

description: I had a good cafè au lait but the owner is unfriendly and there are no plugs for anybody to charge their computers. This place is bad if you want to stay there and use your computer, but it's ok if you have to get a coffee to go.
author: Federico B.

description: I'm updating my review to grant Cafe Bean three stars instead of the one star I gave them in 2007 in a pique of annoyance that they wouldn't let me plug my laptop into the wall. That was seven years ago, this is now, the owner has reconsidered and asked me to do the same. I think it's a perfectly nice little cafe, very humble and comfy, the window pillow seat is a nice place to lounge as others have said.
author: Gil S.

description:
Cozy Coffee Nook in the Hood...

Ac couple of large community tables, counter seating, outside seating and even smaller tables & one nestled next to the window - best seat in the house.

Good spot for breakfast & brunch.... aside from the coffee.
author: Teena Marie T.

description:
I have a high tolerance for bad things when they are convenient (for example, see my review for Tao Yin Restaurant).  In this case, Bean is near work and it isn't cash only. 

The owner has gotten really bitter over the past few months, it's a drag paying money to have someone get mad at you for their own crises.
author: Taylor S.

description: Love this Cafe!  Chester is the man with the magic touch on the expresso machine!!  My fav is the white mocha.  The food is great too!
author: Karri T.

description: Great java for the morning and good beer on tap for the late afternoon, with a creative food menu to boot. If you're a coffeeshop aficionado like me and avoid Starbucks like the plague, this is the alternative. Chester, the owner, is a great guy if you get to know him. Outdoor seating too. It's my neighborhood coffee shop for a reason.
author: Brian J.

description:
This place is a mess. I've gone here a few times, just because it is close to where I work. I feel like its asking for health and consumer code violations. 

First, the bathroom has had an "out of order" sign on it for months, although I once saw an employee use it. 

Second, they currently have two price listings for their selection. The one (the less expensive one) is hung over the bar, so its where one would look when ordering.  It is also permanent text printed out and framed. The second price list  (the more expensive) is a white board, hung on the far back wall.  I noticed that my total bill was more than the more prominent price listing, and the owner told me that the white board prices are the current prices, but he hasn't "had time" yet to take down the list hung directly above the bar. 

Finally, I'm a dog owner, but there's a bit of a yuck factor when there's random dogs inside of a cafe. Not only does the owner not mind people bringing in their pets, but I saw him once pet a dog and then directly go to serving people. Want some dog hair with your muffin? 

Despite the fact that I've returned a few times for convenience, I'm done with this cafe.
author: Rachel F.

description:
One of the best cafe mochas i have ever had! (and i am coffee snob)  my husband used to live in San Francisco and when I went to SF for a visit, one of the first places he took me to was here.  I had no idea what to get so he ordered his favorite: large cafe mocha and an "everything" bagel sandwich with creme cheese, tomato, avocado and onion.  And. I. Was. Hooked.  it was super deelish!  Every time I went to San Francisco, i made it a point to stop here for my coffee fix at least a few times!  The coffee was delicious every time i went - especially when it is made by Chester!
It has been a while since I was last in SF and I still find myself craving it sometimes!  One day I will be back, Cafe Bean... one day soon!
author: Jenifer C.

description:
You're not welcome here if you access the internet from your own laptop.  Or if you're over sixty.  That's the impression I have of this place.

Let me back up: I guess I should start out by saying the food is decent, ambiance is comfy, and that my first experience there was all-around pretty satisfying.  I was ready to recommend this spot to all my wayward friends traveling through SF.

So I did recommend the place: to my parents, who went there for breakfast the next day.  Now, I'm not sure if the owner/cashier is a moody guy, or if he hates tourists (we're from the South Bay, but....whatever), or if he hates older people (which is what I suspect, seeing how my 26-year old self received amazing service), but from the story my folks gave me, he was incredibly rude this time around.  

Right off the bat, my dad requested an internet code when he placed his order.  The guy would not give it to him, claiming he'd been there before and should have still had it.  The man flashed the code in front my dad for a second and then put it away.  My dad is a shy guy and won't question people, so he didn't challenge the owner--he just kept his laptop in his bag, even though that was the point of heading to the cafe.  He never even got on the internet.

After receiving their food, my parents, who are both in their sixties, asked if it'd be all right to move to a more spacious table that had just been vacated.  The worker/cashier/owner (?) gave them a terse "I'm bussing this" and continued.  

That's pretty much the main theme of this review: my parents got major attitude here.  My dad said he even tried to compliment that guy on the cafe, saying it was "reallly nice, great location, great menu."  The owner said, and I quote, "yeah."

He even interrupted their meal to tell them that they'd have to move if another customer came in.

It's strange to me, having been there just the previous day and having had such a different experience.  I even saw that same owner aiding a young pair of travelers with their route down to Los Angeles.  Maybe he was in a bad mood today?  Or maybe it's something else?...

It shouldn't matter if you're young, old, a tourist, a local, or what -- you should be treated with some decency if you're gracing an establishment with your business.  In fact, you really should be treated better than decent.  My parents won't be returning to Cafe Bean.  Neither will I.
author: Cat T.

description: Cafe Bean is wonderful!  Consistently wonderful!  Thank you for clean, fast and friendly service!  Best apple streusel around!
author: Veronica M.

description:
Came here in the late afternoon for two hours before dinner. The decor is quite nice but the customer service here is pretty darn crappy!

- The cafe mocha I ordered a bit watery
- I needed to use the bathroom so I walked over and saw that I didn't need a key so I went inside. I heard some kind of noise but didn't pay much attention to it. While I did my business in a span of 3 minutes I finally realize that the noise was from the sink. It was on and water was filling into a bucket. Then I heard a knock and then a series of very angry knocks on the door in less than a minute. I thought it was some kind of emergency so I opened the door before I got to wash my hands. There was this lady who then yelled at me saying, "Why would I go into the bathroom if I saw the sink was running?" I didn't want to argue so I walked away very pissed off. If I saw that then I wouldn't have used the bathroom and I would have needed to wash my hands after I was done so I would have turned off the sink eventually. And why would you use the sink in the bathroom to run errands for the cafe? A bit unsanitary don't you think?  

She didn't even apologize and even complained really loudly after I left the bathroom. I was a customer and she treated me like I was in her home disturbing her routine.
author: Sarah C.

description: Nice quaint spot. I have ordered the earl grey tea with steamed milk, I like that they have honey out on the counter. Their double vanilla latte was delicious, strong and got me buzzing through my studies !
author: Tran N.

description:
Oh man this is a great little heavenly breakfast place!!

This cafe is perfectly situated at the east and south corner so that you can get the most sunshine... and on this sunny Sunday morning me and my company were soaking in the sun after days of the tiring rain...

Sitting at the cushioned sofa corner of the cafe, having my mouth-watering delicious cinnamon sugar dutch pancake (thin crusted edge crepe style, heaven!!!) with dark French coffee (you can ask for soy milk as they keep it in the fridge), while also forking into my friend's Van Gogh omelette (bell pepper, onion, avocado, replaced cream cheese with olive spread, and eggs with egg whites.)

The deco is very Netherlands with lots of bright colours, high ceiling, even the bathroom where they also used as kinda a storage room impressed me :)

What more can I ask for? It's a totally easy-to-miss place as it looks totally ordinary from the outside. Don't let the outside fool you.
author: T L.

description: Quaint, decent food (veggie burrito was much more delicious than I expected when it showed up to my table naked) and coffee is above average. Perks; non dairy milk, staff are helpful and the front porch is a beautiful place to read a newspaper.
author: Avery B.

description:
Third breakfast. Third time is the charm. Rereading my previous yelps that dutch pancake was pretty legit, but so was this egg white, tofu and veggie omelet. Doused with ketchup (my move) and served with wheat toast (their move), it was exactly was I was looking for.

On a day where it is just a bit to cold for the park yet to warm to be inside, enjoying this fine breakfast by the open windows looking out onto the city felt just right.
author: Jason B.

description:
The dutch pancakes are very good: crispy and well browned on the outer edges, and "al dente"  on the inside.

The espresso is good: I liked the macchiatto (See my photo)

The green tea latte is very good: they use a green tea powder mix; I don't know which brand, but whatever it is, it's very good.  It doesn't have the "metalic taste" of some green tea lattes; it's more gritty, in a good way.  And the perfect amount of sweetness.
author: Scott F.

description: Sad little place that evidently survives by local clientele. Saw no smiles from wait staff (1).  You definitely have to be a regular to understand this place. Terrible seating, average food (we ordered egg sandwich on wheat--the one at my home was better).  Will not revisit
author: Larry W.

description:
Oh dutch cinnamon sugar pancakes and bacon. :) I think thats all I need to express. 
I loved this place, from the decor and the couch corner to their food and papaya nectar. It made my morning. Plus, they had brie on a croissant too, but those pancakes were too hard to pass up.
author: Katie P.

description: Great for getting some work done, good wifi. The sun in this weather makes the spot in the right corner very agreeable.
author: Krito R.

description:
Chester is the best!

I have been coming here for almost 4 years and no one can possibly beat his breakfast sandwhiches on a croissant.  Its impossible.

I love how he always remembers me and is very nice plus the food is great!

There's nothing more you can possibly ask for!

I always bring my guests here to experience his food at least once while they visit me.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Came here for lunch with a few friends. We each got a sandwich, and we were each very disappointed. Each sandwich cost about 7 dollars, and consisted of two pieces of bread, with two slices of meat in them, which took probably 3 seconds to put together, and cost them about 35 cents to produce. 

Was not full or satisfied when I left. This is probably an OK place for a coffee on the go, but not much else.
author: Kristen R.

description:
Tiny cafe bean made my trek to Muir woods very exciting.My friends and i got to this tiny cute place to get some breakfast to go.

   I got a cup of coffee and two mini oatmeal cookies which had some flaxseeds embedded on it;that's all i needed for the cookie to steal my heart!! My friends got yummy bagel sandwiches with eggs,and bacon and as we sat in the car and were munching on the food,i could hear my friends go hmmm yummm.yeah!! they enjoyed their sandwich and i enjoyed eating my oatmeal cookie like a chipmunk sipping coffee at the side.

   The place is tiny,with friendly people and it does look like a great brunch place with out door and indoor seating.I am glad i stepped into Cafe Bean and not Coffee Bean! :)

-Smriti
author: Smriti K.

description:
I stop by here every so often during the week to pick up my occasional mocha before work - some mornings I need that extra kick, you know?  But someone I met recently recommended that I stay and eat breakfast there too because their food is yummy.  

So, my boyfriend and I ventured over there last Sunday and tried their "Dutch Smash" (also recommended): toasted large dark good-for-you bread slice topped with sauteed onions, slices of tomato, cheese and fried egg.  It certainly was yummy!  Can't wait to come back to try some other breakfast goodies there!
author: Maile N.

description: Really love coming here for the breakfast. I've eaten here about once every couple days for the past 3 months and have no complaints about the food. Chester's Chai Tea is something I constantly crave and have gotten friends hooked on. The family can have their on and off days when it comes to good customer service, but I figure I would too if I worked in that shop every day. It's nice to go somewhere where the owner knows my name and what I like to order; reminds me of my small town home.
author: Aaron L.

description: Comfortable, relaxing cafe with a welcoming ambience. It quickly came to feel like an extension of my living room, but with much better food and beverage service. Great place to linger with something to read -- on or offline -- though you may end up eating/drinking more than you intended.
author: Ken A.

description: I was in Amsterdam a while ago and loved their pancakes. I had a craving for Dutch pancakes and discovered that Coffee Bean serves them. Their pancake is more like a crepe; thin and light. I ordered the pancake with strawberries. They sprinkled powder sugar and cut the strawberries thin and arranged them nicely on my pancake. Add a little syrup and it was delicious. The cafe has a European flavor and their cappuccino was great. I talked to Chester, the owner of the cafe and he was really nice. I work downtown so it's a bit of a walk, but I will make an effort to go again and try their other pancakes! eet smakelijk!
author: Allie L.

description: Great little neighborhood cafe and dinner. Has a range of typical American fare, as well as excellent european style pancakes (aka Crepes).
author: Aish F.

description:
Quick food in a cute cafe. 
I like cute, always makes my experience better. 
Starter: Iced Caramel Latte with skim. VERY GOOD!!! Perfect amount of all ingredients. Gave me my daily needed kick. 
Cinnamon and Raisin Bagel w/Cream Cheese. Soft, warm bagel and just the right of amount of CC. 
Hubby + Kid had pork sausage, it was generous in size, scrambled eggs, sour dough toast. (Husband Raved over it) 
Total bill under $16.00 
Good, Cute, Inexpensive and not too busy!
author: Jen T.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and come here frequently for brunch on Saturdays or Sundays. I typically order the lox omelet and get it tailored to my taste (plus avocado and tomato.) 

It's a straightforward meal but it's exactly what I want and crave on the weekends. 

The gentleman and lady who run the spot are amiable and attentive.  

I'd encourage you to go but don't steal my comfy couch spot in near the window! ;)
author: Currin B.

description: Love this place!!! Food is really good and they are also willing to customize things for people. The coffee is good too and inexpensive. :)
author: Brandi B.

description: This place is great! Chester and Nancy are wonderful as well! I come here every morning on my way to work for their great coffee and breakfast!
author: Mollie O.

description: cozy,  chairs doesn't match, vegie sandwich was ok but only 3 different kinds of chips, price was moderate. This place was just ok.
author: roderick s.

description: Dog in heat breakfast burrito and spinach and Brie on croissant to go with coffee under $15, close to my hotel. Walking distance. It took them a minute to get everything ready but it was yummy.
author: Denise B.

description: Not sure when their last health inspection was. I ordered a vanilla latte and watched as the barista steamed my milk with an old milk coated steaming wand then stirred it all together with a spoon he pulled out of an opaque cup of water. I don't even want to know how long it had been since that was changed. I'm all for hole in the walls and local businesses, but it's not that difficult to keep a small place clean. In other news, my blueberry muffin was tasty.
author: Lisa R.

description: This coffee shop with Wifi is right below my friend's place where I cat sit. The coffee is good and strong, the CAT (Cream Cheese, Avocado, Tomato) bagels are yummy and the guy who has the same last name as me is real nice. The place is clean well lit and cozy inside with a few tables in the sun outside. I need to try a dutch pancake soon, looks good!
author: Karen T.

description:
Nice friendly place with outdoor seating and good beer.  I've never been disappointed.  The French prints are nice and I didn't see too many hipsters on laptops during the times I go (thank goodness).

This place is convenient and comfortable.

Try to snag an outdoor table and enjoy the view :)
author: Justin C.

description:
After much debate, my roommate & I decided we'd give Cafe Bean a shot. The pictures of Dutch pancakes were simply TOO freakin' delicious looking to pass up. Crepes? Who needs crepes when you have Dutch pancakes. Perfectly seasoned logic!

So after a short walk from our apartment we arrive to find the place littered with locals and tourists alike. A very good vibe. The woman behind the counter was nice and very accommodating. Chester himself, red & yellow hair tips was bustling about, tending to customers, taking orders, etc. Very good service.

We take a seat, of which there were plenty, and sip on our delicious coffees and wait for the food. A short while later, the arrive. The Dutch Pancake Blaster with cheese, eggs and ham. And the pancake with strawberrrrrrries. Oh hellz yes. 
A little slippery on the plate, but WHOLLY delicious. The strawberries tasted very fresh & the ham, cheese, egg trifecta was perfection. Sweet & savory bliss. Really, I could go on and on, but you'd be better off trying it yourself.

The place is great & with a smattering of locals, you'll be sure to find well-dressed art students, artsy 20-somethings and tattooed coffee-lovers. Trés San Francisco. Come here for an authentic SF-coffee/breakfast experience!
author: Sloane W.

description:
We went into Café Bean, a coffeehouse in Nob Hill.  I see this place all the time when I ride the 2 Clement or 3 Jackson Muni bus.

We order a double espresso and a green tea latte.  Yes, I said green tea latte.  I don't see this drink too much on coffee menus.  I found it be have a little bit too much milk, but my husband thought it was perfect.  We both agreed this was delicious.  Their double espresso did not have as much cream in the top of the cup, but the coffee itself was not bitter and ended up being good too.

When we go back here, this will be our green tea latte spot.
author: Janet H.

description:
Cafe Bean has always been a good breakfast/lunch/brunch spot to eat at or just hang out drinking coffee or Italian sodas. It's a cute little cafe with awesome baristas/waiter and the owner is always friendly. My favorite part of the cafe would be the window seating with the comfy comfy couch and huge pillows. When it's a sunny day, like recently, it's good to grab a seat outside and enjoy your breakfast/lunch outside in the sun with umbrellas over you so you won't feel burnt.

Food wise, awesome selection of different options. You wouldn't get bored here. They always have specials on the board. Some menu items include bagels, baked goods (LOVE the almond croissant!), omelets, sandwiches, french toast, granola with fresh fruit, and Dutch pancakes!!!!!

Some of my favorites are the Cody's omelet (chicken apple sausage, mushroom, onion, cheese  $7.95), Dutch Smasher!! (two fried eggs, ham, tomato, onion on top of toast with cheese...yumm!! $7.50) my FAVORITE.. It is soooooo good!!! The pancakes are always crispy at the edges, just how I like em' and always perfectly pan fried! You could just taste the awesome buttery taste in every bite!

This is the first place I had my first cup of coffee anything. They do yummy white mocha lattes, green tea lattes, and chai lattes. They also serve Italian soda of many different flavors. 

Like I said again, great place rain or shine. If you want good breakfast/lunch/brunch, yummy coffee with friendly service, this is the place to go!!!
author: Juliane N.

description:
Some days, when everything is going wrong, and the people I love most are either nowhere to be found or have let me down miserably, I just wish that Jill S could astrally project herself (or hop on a boring old plane) back here, so that we could sit in the cushiony softness of the big window seat at Cafe Bean, sip coffee and green tea lattes, and munch on macaroons. I'd put my head on her shoulder and she'd hug me like best friends do, remind me that I'm better than all the stupid crap bringing me down, and then we'd get the hell out of there and do what we do best: get TRASHED. And dance. And laugh hysterically. And generally be the two most obnoxious creatures on the face of the earth. 
God, I miss the good old days with Jill at Cafe Bean, where the people are friendly and the coffee is strong and delicious. And there's outdoor seating. And macaroons. And pretty much everything you need.
author: Autumn K.

description:
i love cafe bean!

i live across the street and am usually there every day. the owner knows me by name and knows what i order. sometimes, hes even got it ready for me when i come in. 

the coffee is pretty good, as is the food. but, i come here mostly for the company of awesome locals and that everyone knows my name.

many afternoons this past summer were spent sitting at the tables in front observing all of the interesting happenings at jones and sutter. my roommate and i even coined our most infamous game here...french or homeless?
author: Ameigh F.

description: Hubby said best cup of coffee...he likes it very strong.  Had a cappuccino and split egg & ham croissant sandwich...very good!  They need to update decor so it's more inviting but maybe they don't want people hangin round too long.  Spent $13 with tip.  Service was good...not busy sun am.  Will definitely visit again!
author: Antonette W.

description:
One word. Awesome.
I love their tea coolers and omelettes because they are delicious and their fillings are unusual.  White mochas are a favorite of mine because they are not too sweet.  The green tea latte's are the best in the city.  I enjoy the couch seating in the bright sunny corner.  This cafe is highly recommended for vegetarians.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Good Coffee. Good Food. Free Wi-Fi. No Electricity.

I walked around the 'loin a while to find a good coffee shop to settle into to write a paper for school. I settled on Cafe Bean because it seemed large and inviting. Free wi-fi but no power. I was limited to my battery-life during my stay. The person working the counter even told me when I was looking for an outlet that they don't provide outlets for laptops.

The coffee was very good. I'm not a Golden Cup coffee judge but I found the coffee pleasant. They give you a monster ceramic mug so you don't have to keep getting up. 

A pet peeve are coffee shops that charge 50-75 cents for a refill on top of a $1.85 for the initial cup and then pass you a 6-oz cup while I could have had a 16-oz to-go cup for the same price. I'd like to not add to the trash problems of the world and enjoy drinking from a real mug. Cafe Bean was very, very accommodating in that sense.

I also had the lox plate. I like that Mediterranean-style breakfast of bagel or toast with olive tepenade, smoked salmon, cream cheese and veggies - spread out so you can pick at it however you want. It was a little pricey - about $8 - but I was sticking around for a while.

When I refilled my coffee, I also had an excellent almond croissant. Quite tasty - not too sweet.

But then my battery was getting low, so I read journal articles and packed up to find some power...
author: Eric W.

description:
This place used to be owned by the fabulous and sweet Bianca. It also used to be teeny tiny and on Post St.
The newer location is bright (by San Francisco standards) and there is outdoor seating to. Good place for a little breakfast or late afternoon treats. The Bean has a nice international appeal.
author: Melissa B.

description:
amsterdam cafe
Bulldog posters on the walls
but you can't do drugs
author: Tyler G.

description:
Can I five-star this place 'cause its bathroom is plastered with R. Crumb smut and the papered walls encourage graffiti? Yes, God damn it, I can. I tagged that isht up.

Also: relaxed sunlit dandy serving killer omelettes and fresh guava juice.
author: Daniel P.

description:
I LOVE my apartment! And one of the reasons is Cafe Bean right outside my front door! Coffee is my vice...and I'm ok with that! So I'm glad it's close by! The extras for the coffee are great! I love that they have an assortment of spices and sugars so you can customize your cup!  But the greatest thing about Cafe Bean is that they serve the best breakfast.  One of the simple pleasures in life is sitting in the sunny widow sipping coffee and enjoying breakfast on a Sunday morning with someone you love! Now what could be better than that?! 

Thanks Chester!!!
author: Charisse F.

description: I see people complaining about other aspects of this shop. Its a coffee shop first and everything else 2nd. Would you go to a pizza shop and give it 2 stars because you didn't like their salad? Don't be ridiculous. If the coffee is bad then a lower score is appropriate. Some person said it was messy and "weird," but thats the part of this shop that I like. The shop is organized in a way that makes you feel like your at someones home rather than some business. Yeah customer service could be slightly improved, but I will take quality over service any day. I don't care about perfect customer service, because I would rather they have more attention on their work at hand. Which is what they do here. I usually get an americano at coffee shops because I feel its a good measure of how good everything is, since most specialty drinks are espresso based. This was one of the best americano's I've had. It was mellow yet full of flavor. Most times I feel like I need cream and sugar to improve the overall experience of the beverage, but I didn't want to ruin this drink with them.
author: Mark A.

description:
I think this place is pretty cute. The staff is a friendly crew. I think they might be family, but I'm not sure.

The food is tasty (bagel with cream cheese, avocado and tomato...so good!) While I agree that the coffee isn't the greatest (I'm drinking it right now and it tastes a little watery to me) it's still decent. And yes, better than Starbucks (as I've heard other people talking about in previous posts.)

I do enjoy the place though...it's quiet and friendly, the walls are bright so that makes the place seem bigger. I like the curved wall in the back part of the place...just makes it look personable. And I'm currently sitting in the window seat and am enjoying the sunshine (which I was shocked to see after the horrid rains of yesterday).

If you're in the hood, check it out. It's a quaint and cute little place. :)
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Coffee is not the best, but then again it's always better than starbucks...but the setting is very lively, crew is nice, there's free wifi (which isn't the case at Starbucks), and if you've been to Amsterdam, then you've been to the bulldog cafe and you'll be able to appreciate the decor on the wall (don't be mistaken though, they have a poster of the bulldog cafe, not the products...)

It,s just a cool little neighborhood joint (no pun intended), nothing pretentious, just nice.
author: Clara T.

description: They make decent coffee and espresso drinks, but I was quite disappointed one morning when I ordered what should have been a quick breakfast before work with a friend, and had to wait so long for it that I had to take it to go. The person behind the counter apologized for the wait, and the breakfast sandwich was fairly good, but the wait put a damper on my morning, and it was definitely not busy enough to justify it.
author: Irene M.

description:
Over the past couple of years I've lived in the city, I've become a regular at Cafe Bean. I was first attracted to the cafe by its proximity to my apartment, but upon learning that they served oregon chai lattes, I knew I'd found my new neighborhood haunt. 

The atmosphere is homey, unique, and hip, with Chester (the owner) providing friendly service along with all the drink orders. Seating includes communal tables, a cozy nook, and a few umbrellaed outdoor tables. It's a popular spot for young locals to meet up with a few friends (or to study; wi-fi is free to customers). 

Cafe Bean offers a variety of beers on tap as well as coffee drinks, and a number of breakfast dishes, pastries, sandwiches/paninis, and sides. No matter what your day looks like, this cafe can always serve up a steaming hot beverage and a tasty meal.
author: N P.

description: Lovely juices, more breakfast items than I might anticipate from a cafe & friendly service.  It has the feel of a cute neighborhood cafe, complete with the cushioned bench in the window.  The food is, as others have said, fairly straightforward.  Little in the way of flair or presentation but this did not bother me in the least.  A glass of mango juice and breakfast sandwich on a croissant was just what I needed.  My only complaint?  A little pricey for what it is but worth a stop if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Jayme P.

description:
green tea latte: mmmm 1 star
chai: mmmmm 1 star
comfy feel to this cafe, nice interior.. blah blah 1 star.


1+1+1= 3. yay.
author: Susy C.

description:
Warmy, Cozy, neighborhood cafe~

Easy, Simple, Quick way to grab a nice cup of morning coffee and breakfast sandwich. 

I had Beagle with Peanut butter and Jam..... and it was great!
What impressed me the most was that, they do the simple thing RIGHT!!

Come on down!!
author: Andrew W.

description:
It's a good change of pace from the usual breakfast spot. They have a decent selection of food ranging from dutch pancakes to omelets to sandwiches. There's an art school crowd being so close to the academy. It's a nice spot to read the paper over breakfast, but a little overpriced. Oh, and when you pay with a credit card, they don't have a spot to leave a tip so bring a couple bucks to throw into the pitcher.

Update: I have been going back regularly for breakfast and also for beers on a nice day. The food gets better and better! I love people watching at one of their outdoor tables. I'm upping my vote to 4 stars from 3.
author: Defne A.

description:
The green tea latte here is a must try! It was perfect: not too sweet and not too bitter. It was so tasty that I almost ordered a second one but I refrained...I live close by so I figure there will be plenty of time to indulge in another one. Like this afternoon, perhaps :) 

The salmon omelette was good but not spectacular. I probably would have liked it more had I not just tried a to-die-for salmon omelette at Canteen the other day. If the salmon were a little bit more smokey it would be better. The portion was huge, so you definitely get your money's worth! I don't think I'll be needing anything to eat until dinner.

Cafe Bean's interior is cute and eclectic, the staff is really friendly (they seemed to know a lot of the customers by name which is nice) and the prices are good ($11 for an omelette and a latte). If you're in the Union Square / Lower Nob area you should definitely give this place a try!
author: Amanda R.

description:
This has got to stop.  Seriously.  I figured by the time I reached my current age I would've grown out of the Jewish guilt.  But no.  It comes back each and every day to bite me in the ass.  Why do I walk out of my way to get a cup of so-so coffee?  Why do I insist on even having another cup of coffee even though two are already burbling in my tummy and my hands are already shaky?
Guilt.  Plain and simple.  When I lived in this hood I'd go here from time to time and befriended the owner and his wife.  I heard about the struggle to stay open, the plight of a small-business owner, and he knows my name and calls me by it!  Sheesh...I think I need therapy.  :)
author: Zev K.

description:
Friendly coffee shop and this is where I GET my coffee everyday!
you see lots of tourist here for breakfast, brunch or even for afternoon tea break! a little international coffee shop around the hood.

If you ever lost and want to find the direction, ask Justin - I'm sure he has the map ready for you...
author: Flora H.

description: This place was down the block from our hotel so my bf and I decided to wake up extra early to get our breakfast here. i love the atmosphere and cozy feeling inside, but seating can be a pain when it's a bit crowded. service did take a bit long because the man working here was preparing breakfast for other people when we came in, which we didn't mind at all. at least he's being attentive with our food! we enjoyed our drinks and meal and would come back again!
author: Chi N.

description:
The service could use some work.  I've been in eh.. 3-5 times on a few SF trip and everytime was greeted by a different group of college students causing a ruckus.  That in itself can put a visitor off.

Considering my cafe standards are quite low coming from a southern california point of view.  We have very few cafes and they are usually sub par (if even),

I  ordered an onion bagel with cream cheese, lox, and tomato (awesome) though eh.. a little over priced.  I could've walked to some super market and made it myself but hey... why make the effort.

I did also order a breakfast plate that wasn't really pallatable.  It might've been the eggs or something but it just wasn't good.

But to every cloud the silver lining was a breakfast sandwich that took my breath away.  Wheat bread, thinly sliced ham, cheese, red onions, over medium egg.  Heaven.  It sounds like a hodge podge of ingredients but I was in love.  Ah.

My boyfriend and I don't drink coffee so we ordered their orange juice.  Uhm, in all of it's sour glory it seemed VERY fresh squeezed.  Sugar anyone?

Oh and a few doors down there's a nice shoe shop for any shoe heads out there looking for something different (again in according to so cal standards)

Oh and the lady that cooks in the kitchen is terrifying especially if she takes your order.

There's a potentially amiable asian man that works register on occasion.  I say potentially because it doesn't seem genuine or sincere but at least he faked it.
author: Cayleen O.

description: Great service and food was delicious. We ordered the chicken apple sausage & smoked bacon with eggs & toast. Overall, cute little coffee shop and I will definitely come in again for breakfast.
author: J. L.

description:
**updated 7/8/06**
Downgraded to MEH~ due to mediocre Dutch pancakes, used to be better before the ownership change. White chocolate mocha was so so. Disappointing.

**previous review** 4 stars
The place to go for a breakfast of Dutch pancakes, with white chocolate mocha served in a latte bowl. 

Service falls between good or suck depending on how busy they are.
author: Trixie J.

description:
It's a freaking coffee shop!  Who cares, right?  But really, there is something about the way that ambience can envigorate the taste buds.  

The ambience here (and it took me a few visits to realize this) is above average.  I don't think it's the best, but I think it deserves some credit.  

Yeah the name sucks, but don't all coffee houses have crappy names?  

I'm just happy that it's open early on the weekends when I need it the most.  And the ham and cheese croissant that I had last sunday was ridiculously good (it was the cheese, but I don't know what kind - gruyere?)

But really, who reads reviews about coffeeshops?

Have we really become this pathetic in our own daily lives to be writing about coffee shops when what we really want to write about is sex?
author: chris o.

description:
I've always wanted to go in - there are cute little couches in the window, and I love me some comfy chairs.

Unfortunately, it was pretty disappointing. They gave me a cold ceramic mug for coffee, and I was too shy to ask them to heat it up with hot water, so my coffee was lukewarm. I did ask for (and was given) some skim milk for my coffee, which I appreciated.

and the TV was on kinda loud, which was distracting - I wanted to read. oh well, it wasn't bad, but it wasn't my kinda place.
author: zoe s.

description: Really Good Latte. Seriously, may be the best I've had, not sure why, but it was damn good. The dutch pancakes looked great, but alas I only had coffee
author: Kelly C.

description: The espresso here is some of the best you can get in the neighborhood. In fact it's the only place where I feel like I can actually get any caffeine. The fare that is served here is somewhat decent, although I could outbake and outcook whoever is back there in the kitchen any day of the week. Interwebs is free, and since I only live half a block away when my internet is down I come down here and sit outside (if it's a nice day) or sit in one of their fantastically comfy and cute cornerbooths against the window. This is a good neighborhood cafe. Also.... they serve draft beer here. And it's only $3 during their happy hour.
author: Y K.

description:
Shame for what was once a gem in the neighborhood...Typically had a very European feel and fine espresso but everything has dropped off from there now...Not surprisingly, original owner is no longer the Dutch woman with her parrot that gave the place it's charm.

The Dutch pancakes remain and highlight their menu but service, quality and overall feel has really suffered.

Used to be one of my favorite stopovers.

Too bad...My advice to owners is to at least take your espresso up a notch...Try some Illy!
author: Barca F.

description: I'm a bit of an espresso junkie, so when a coffee shop gets it right, I have to talk about it. Blue Bottle still holds the flame for best Americano in the city, but at that price they better be. The $1.75 americano at Cafe Bean puts every single Starbucks to shame. Chester even makes sure to preserve the foam on top when topping off the cup. It's the little things. Speaking of Chester, the last time I was at Cafe Bean was about 4 months ago. When I came in today, he remembered me by name. Awesome!
author: Dan W.

description:
So I may be a bit biased but I am because this place is great. I usually roll in late in the morning to be greeted by smiles and hot coffee. Cool and casual atmosphere, usually very attentive and genuine service. Late afternoon happy hour beers are my favorite, sitting in the sun street side, using the free WI-fi that is provided and people watching. See you there. 
Aaron
author: Aaron L.

description: Green tea latte, dirty... sounds weird, but you gotta try it.  The owner Chester suggested it to me one morning when I appeared a bit drowsy.  All it is, is a green tea latte with an espresso shot in it... I dare you to try it.  Also, they do a great morning bagel and met spek or some kind of pancake with cheese, eggs, and ham on top... again sounds gross... but Yummmmyyyyy!
author: Lauren H.

description: Back when I used to live on sutter, this was my favorite breakfast place. I only ordered scrambled eggs and a bagel (boring, I know) but it was always a delicious breakfast. Hot and fresh food, good service, cholula bottles, and outdoor seating makes this place a real winner.
author: Meagan R.

description: This is a great little spot to grab a good breakfast, or just a cup of coffee. I have been here a few times with my friend who lives in Nob Hill, and have never been disappointed. The service here is wonderful! My friend has a pug that she brings here regularly, and the owner always has some treats on hand for her. It is all about the dutch pancakes! Mmm Mmm Good! If you can, try to grab one of the outdoor tables for some good people watching.
author: Yvonne K.

description: love, love, love cafe bean! I have been coming here since I moved to SF 2 years ago. Chester is a sweetheart! They have free wifi but you'll have to charge your computer somewhere else---there's no place to plug it into. I love their smoked salmon omelette and if you have a sweet tooth, you absolutely must try their dutch pancakes---nutella and banana, to be exact. (you can always ask for extra bananas). Most of the people in the cafe are students and the occasional tourist. It's a great place to people watch on a warm summer day.
author: Dara v.

description: I stopped by here before heading to BART to the airport, and I sure was pleasantly surprised. The owner, Chester, is an extremely nice person and genuinely makes u feel at home in his store. I got the green tea latte n that is a very unusual n tasty concoction. I will definitely be back next time I come to SF
author: Ian Y.

description: Running out of Splenda or caffeinated tea in the morning used to be a real disaster for me.  I actually feel like I'm walking through water when I don't get my morning fix.  Now that I've discovered Cafe Bean's vanilla almond tea, running out at home is no longer a problem.  It's so much better than the bulk Lipton or store brand that I buy.  If only I could afford it every day!  I realize it's less than a couple bucks, but I drink A LOT of tea.
author: Lauren C.

description: The tuna salad here is sooooo good. The food is all pretty decent. I don't love the green tea latte or the flavored lemonade, but the food is good. The staff is awesome, and the cafe is comfy. This is definitely my go to brunch place after a night out.
author: Monika M.

description: I love this place not only for the coffee but for the hospitality. Chester is an awesome fella and always remembers me and my order whenever I walk in. The atmosphere is great, indoor or out.
author: Jenny L.

description: We went here for breakfast while on vacation. I just had a bagel because I wasn't that hungry. My boyfriend had a dutch pancake with eggs and bacon that tasted very good. The coffee was good as well. The store front is very charming. I give it three stars not because it wasn't good, because the food is solid and I would recommend it, it just isn't particularly creative.
author: Emme J.

description: Big dutch pancakes for $6.00 and good coffee. We walked past the tourist pancake spots in Union Square and headed to Cafe Bean. No wait on a Sunday morning @ 10:00!!!!  We ordered at the counter and took seat outside at a sidewalk table.  The staff was helpful and friendly. They even came outside several times to check on us. I had an apple pancake and my wife had the cinnamon sugar. To sum things up....this place rules!!!!
author: G S.

description: It's better ambiance than Cup of Joe up the street and nicer staff.  The coffee isn't as good though but the prices are reasonable.  Actually I should say that if you're getting a pastry or a bagel topped with refrigerated condiments (read: cream cheese or veggies, pb and j) then it's reasonably priced food; the other breakfast items seem pretty pricey and run around $7 and up.  Free WiFi and a sunny corner with outdoor tables and dog friendliness.  The green tea latte is the most amazing thing EV-ER and a must try.  This place is closer to my building than any other cafe.  Which is good cuz I'm kind of a  lazy biatch before I'm caffeinated; afterwards I'm like Speedy Gonzales.  Arriba! Arriba! Endale! Endale!
author: Jill D.

description: Clean and comfortable cafe that is a couple of stores away from Huf.  It helps when you're in line for a pair of limited kicks and need a pick me up or a bathroom.   Really good breakfast, especially the Masher (Everything that's good about breakfast stacked up).  I'd recommend the green tea latte, it has to be the best in the city.  Friendly owners and Free Wi-Fi.   Oh yeah, decent Koffie!
author: Jason A.

description: Cafe Bean is my favorite neighborhood spot for coffee.  The Dutch coffee is top notch and I love their soy lattes.  This cozy Euro-style cafe is the perfect place to hang out with friends and catch up over great coffee.  They have traditional Dutch cafe food and good sandwiches.  The owner and staff are super friendly and personable.
author: Kimberly J.

description: Another shop on the daily work walk that I've been curious to try (passing a place three times daily will do that to you I guess). Stopped in for an afternoon tea and was welcomed by a friendly barista and bright yellow interior. Was  sadly dissapointed by the small tea selection and the prices  - one small cheap tea bag will cost you a $1.50..... I think I'll stick to the usual starbucks for twice the tea at half the price. However, the cafe's plush couches and large windows are a great place to cozy up with a friend or good book - maybe the extra cents is worth escaping the sutter street crowds for a chill cup of warm herbal goodness :)
author: Caroline J.

description: I decided to stop in Cafe Bean the other morning instead of my old stand by, Sugar Cafe... It wasn't bad, but I think I'll stick with Sugar 'cuz I like their iced coffee better.
author: Jason R.

description:
I'm a long time Bean patron. The food is exceptional and the staff is great. The kitchen is small so if you're in a hurry to get your food and the place is packed then skip this place or at least be forewarned. Don't give them a crappy rating because you're waiting longer than you'd like. Remember, this place is a CAFE, not a restaurant.

Overall, this is a great place to get a drink and a bite to eat. There's lots of cafe drinks, a decent food selection, and beer on tap or in the bottle and a happy hour.
author: g m.

description: Bean is a little international place that has good coffee and good food, although nothing fabulous.  It is by far better than Cup-a-Joe one block down, so if those are your choices Bean is the way to go.   The window seat makes for a good people watching spot and the staff is friendly and attentive. Good out door seating as well.
author: Vanessa W.

description: Used to stop by all the time for mochas on the way to work. Friendly and nice staff. Outdoor and indoor seating good for people watching, as well as a comfy booth section. Not open at night. $2.75 for a single mocha.
author: Joyce C.

description: kinda made this my normal morning spot... close by and great light. cool place to sit outdoors or in the window if the seats aren't taken. chill place and good expresso.
author: Matthew S.

description: The only drink I order from here is the green tea latte but it is AMAZING!  Pretty much the best I've ever had.  Cafe Bean is just down the street from me and gets my vote for favorite coffee shop on the block.
author: Michelle N.

description: My favorite place to eat late breakfast on sanday... Great food. Nice and cosy inside. Just cool.
author: Vera S.

description: The location is a tad odd for a coffee shop unless you live smack dab downtown, but on the occasional visit I've always liked this place. It's got a funky setup and the coffee ain't so bad, sometimes it's better when it sits out all day. Cool afternoon spot to meet a friend and chat, I love the window seats.
author: Michael E.

description: They make a great sandwich called a Masher. It rocks. This place used to be better a few years ago and seems to have gone a little downhill. I almost gave 4 stars, but its not the same.
author: Zac H.

description: No good food experiences to mention. The last time I was here, they served me lukewarm coffee. That's blasphemous! The last meal I ate here, I spotted a cockroach. I understand that many eateries have cockroaches, but after the cold coffee, I just gave up.
author: Babs P.

description: Never eaten here. Don't want to try. Happy Hour beer and patio is what its about.  Be careful though, too many of those happy hour beers can lead to  drunken walk-ins to Canteen across the street, which you'll not regret but you wallet will!
author: Matt C.

description: Excellent food, wonderful coffee.  The first time we came here, my husband and I shared the lox plate and a cinnamon apple dutch pancake.  He got a white chocolate mocha and I asked for a latte with extra foam.  Everything was perfect, and the guy who made my latte really knows how to make good foam.  The dutch pancake was so good that we went back the very next day for another one.  They're a little more substantial than crepes and lighter than pancakes.  Cooked so they're crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.  Perfect.  The next time we went I switched it up a bit and got an omelet, thinking it couldn't possibly be as good as the pancakes but it sounded so good I had to try it - I was wrong, it was AMAZING.  I didn't know an omelet could be so delicious.  I got the Daniels omelet I think.  The next time we went my husband got an herb brie veggie sandwich (don't quote me on the cheese, it might not have been brie but it was something like it) and a caramel latte.  I got a turkey sandwich, again not expecting much but was floored by how tasty a simple meal could be.  They have a decent beer selection and a few on tap, but we've never tried them.  I'm sure we'll get around to that someday.  In a nutshell, this place does something for me that I value highly: every time I take a bite of something new, I am floored by how delicious it is.  Thank you Cafe Bean.
author: Sierra G.

description: This is my neighborhood coffee spot, I stop here every morning on my way to work. I love Chester, he's awesome! He knows I'm not a morning person, so he gets my double americano ready in a flash, and doesn't try to talk me up too much. I have yet to try the food, but it always smells delicious!
author: Kelly L.

description: I live above this place so I end up here more than I'd like for a quick breakfast. Food isn't bad but it's overpriced and nothing to write home about. The fresh orange juice is good and the cafe itself does have a nice S.F. feel to it.
author: Chris S.

description:
the only reason i ended up here was b/c my sis and i were on a tight schedule, canteen across the street had a long wait, and it's right next door to huf - the reason why we were in this neighborhood in the first place. 

she was dying to get her limited edition dunks, and since it wasn't open yet, we decided to grab a simple breakfast here at cafe bean.

she had eggs and hot links, and i had a tuna pecan salad atop mixed greens. her meal seemed mediocre for what it was. my tuna pecan salad was decent, but they served it with some funky raspberry vinaigrette. no thank you. i asked for something creamy, perhaps ranch, and they DIDN'T HAVE IT! so i settled for honey dijon. 

what kind of establishment, pray tell, doesn't carry even ranch dressing when they serve simple salads? i wasn't expecting  exuberant house creamy pesto or anything like that. 

also, my sister found a strand of hair in her eggs.

so far, not very impressive.

the only reason i give it two stars is b/c as a destination for tea/coffee/bagels, it seems just fine. the decor is somewhat charming, and there is an inviting sunday brunch vibe going on for it. 

convenient if you want a quick sip, but don't go there for any subsistence beyond bagels.
author: jennifer y.

description: While the coffee is average, the friendly staff, free wifi and relaxing space make Cafe Bean a good place to hang out.  The dutch pancakes are worth a try.  I've had most of the savory ones and all those have been great.  The prices are pretty reasonable.  They also offer beers, but I've never been there at an approriate time for tippling.
author: QuodE D.

description:
Their two-person staff is more attentive and alert than an entire Valencia St coffee shop. 
A large Americano and a Smash plate is a totally satisfying way to start the day.  (The Smash doesn't travel too well, though. It comes out hot and steaming, so if you're walking far, it can get mushy in the box.) Breakfast here is part of what makes Sutter St an oasis.
author: rich b.

description: Cafe Bean is my choice in the morning when I don't feel like "perk-n-grinding". Chester knows me by name, has the soy waiting, coffee is never to hot or to cold, its just right...in fact, it might be a perfect slice of Amsterdam on the Nob..well minus the hash.
author: Terry S.

description: I love Cafe Bean! They are so nice! Oh, and the food is fantastic as well. XD Cafe Bean, you guys rock!
author: Rebecca B.

description: This is a great breakfast spot!  The owner is fantastic....remembers what you've ordered and couldn't be nicer.  Great omelettes, etc.  And on a warm sunny day you can sit on the sidewalk and take in the street view.  Highly recommend it!
author: Laura K.

description: Delicious egg cheese bacon bagel, great coffee and an amsterdam theme
author: Dave C.

description: This is a neighborhood jewel. This is a cafe i come hang out at, not because of great food or great coffee but more for the atmosphere and the mood it puts me it. It has a certain warmth and very uplifting quality about it, reminds me of a cafe in italy. The thousands of photos plastered on the tables and european decorations on the wall takes me to a totally different place when i'm there. They also offer WI-FI for the cyber surfers. Anyhow, that's not to say that their food isn't good either. The dutch crepes and coffee are good, though not the best. It's simply a great hang out.
author: benjamin c.

description:
the coffee is alright, just the regular coffee house fare. blue bottle it ain't.
the seating is terrible. inside it's partially on misdesigned benches with filthy pillows. and half the chairs outside are broken.
that place needs badly a revamp.....
author: bmwcafe c.

description: First and foremost: The coffee is bad. One star for the window seat and one star for the nice girl who took my orders until I couldn't take the bad attitude from the Owner/Manager anymore.  I was looking for a cozy neighborhood place to read the weekly and have breakfast on my days off and gave this place a try. After a couple of times going there, they decided to confuse me by taking my order but asking me to pay AFTER I ate. Ok, so I went to my window seat, ate my breakfast, read the paper and drank my coffee... and then I left. It's a habit at a coffee shop to leave when you're done, right? So this young kid who works there chased me down the street and I came back  to pay the bill apologizing all the way. When I walked in the door, blushing and holding my cash out in front of me, that Owner/Manager whatever guy was giving me this mean cold stare and shaking his head. He really thought I did it on purpose. I tried to make a joke and get the guy to lighten up but he just continued to mad-dog me. And from then on, I asked if I could go ahead and pay before hand trying to put the incident behind me. After a few more bad experiences with that same guy, the last time I went I was waiting to order, they were pretty busy, the busser/kitchen guy was running around clearing plates, etc. and that Owner/Manager was bringing out food. He angrily told the busser to "Get OUT of the WAY" and rudely pushed past him and that was just the end for me. I walked out and will never go back.
author: Chris A.

description: cute, cozy spot in the heart of nob hill.  a little oasis among the hustle and bustle. i didn't try their coffee, but i had a cookie (white and dark chocolate chip) that was so-so. not great; just so-so.  still, i give this place three stars for its warm vibe and ambiance.
author: Elle B.
